skill.name: gdpr-data-handling
skill.description: Implement GDPR-compliant data handling with consent management, data subject rights, and privacy by design. Use when building systems that process EU personal data, implementing privacy controls, or conducting GDPR compliance reviews.
skill.summary: Implement GDPR-compliant data handling with consent management, data subject rights, and privacy by ...

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation and example code only. No file access, network calls, or execution patterns are present. No suspicious or obfuscated content found.

content.value_statement: GDPR requirements are complex and easy to miss. This skill provides clear patterns and checklists to implement compliant data handling.
actual_capabilities: Provides consent data model and audit log pattern
Includes GDPR compliant consent UI layout
Implements DSAR processing flow for access, erasure, and portability
Defines data retention policy structure with anonymization option
Outlines breach notification workflow and timelines
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or jurisdiction specific counsel
Requires integration with your data sources and databases
Does not include automated email or notification integrations
Does not cover non GDPR privacy laws in detail

use_cases.title: Plan GDPR scope
use_cases.description: Identify required consent, retention, and DSAR features for a new EU product launch.

use_cases.title: Build DSAR flow
use_cases.description: Implement access, erasure, and portability workflows across multiple data sources.

use_cases.title: Review compliance
use_cases.description: Use the checklist to audit data handling processes and documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Consent basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a GDPR compliant consent capture flow for analytics and marketing with audit logging steps.

prompt_templates.title: DSAR process
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a DSAR access request workflow with verification, deadlines, and data collection steps.

prompt_templates.title: Retention policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose data retention rules for user accounts, support tickets, and analytics with legal bases.

prompt_templates.title: Breach response
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a breach notification plan that meets 72 hour reporting requirements and user notification rules.

output_examples.input: Create a GDPR compliance checklist for a SaaS app handling EU user data.
output: Document legal bases for each processing purpose
Implement DSAR workflows with 30 day response tracking
Define retention periods and enable deletion or anonymization

best_practices: Map each data field to a lawful basis
Log consent changes with timestamps and sources
Separate PII from behavioral data models
anti_patterns: Keeping data without a defined retention period

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is plain text guidance and works in any of those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples only. You must adapt them to your systems and laws.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my stack?
faq.answer: Map the patterns to your data stores and services, then implement the interfaces shown.

faq.question: Does it collect or send user data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is static and contains no data collection or network code.

faq.question: What should I do if a DSAR fails?
faq.answer: Check data source connectivity, verify identity steps, and log exceptions for manual follow up.

faq.question: How does it compare to a legal review?
faq.answer: It is not a substitute. It complements legal review with implementation guidance.
